item.text: Jehoshaphat was very wealthy and greatly respected. He made an alliance by marriage with Ahab,

and <st data-num="07093" class="">after</st> several <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03381" class="">went down</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> visit<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0256" class="">Ahab</st> in <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0256" class="">Ahab</st> <st data-num="02076" class="">slaughtered</st> <st data-num="07230" class="">many</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st> and <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st> to honor Jehoshaphat and <st data-num="05971" class="">those</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> came <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him.<n id="4" /> He <st data-num="05496" class="">persuaded</st> him to join in an <st data-num="05927" class="">attack</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">against</st> <st data-num="07433" class="">Ramoth</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0256" class="">Ahab</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> of <st data-num="03063">Judah</st>, “Will you <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> me to attack <st data-num="07433" class="">Ramoth</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>?” He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “I will <st data-num="03644 03644">support</st> you; my <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> is at your <st data-num="05971" class="">disposal</st> and will <st data-num="05973" class="">support</st> you in <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>.”<n id="1" />
Then Jehoshaphat said further to the king of Israel, “First, please seek an oracle from the Lord.”

So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="06908" class="">assembled</st> <st data-num="0702 03967 0376">400</st> <st data-num="05030" class="">prophets</st> and <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> them, “Should we <st data-num="01980 0413 04421">attack</st> <st data-num="07433" class="">Ramoth</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">or</st> <st data-num="02308" class="">not</st>?”<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="05927" class="">Attack</st>! <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st><n id="2" /> will <st data-num="05414" class="">hand</st> it <st data-num="03027" class="">over</st> to the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>.”
But Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there not a prophet of the Lord still here that we may ask him?”

The king of Israel answered Jehoshaphat, “There is still one man through whom we can seek the Lord’s will, but I despise him because he does not prophesy prosperity for me, but always disaster—Micaiah son of Imlah.” Jehoshaphat said, “The king should not say such things!”
The king of Israel summoned an officer and said, “Quickly bring Micaiah son of Imlah.”

Now the king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah were sitting on their respective thrones, dressed in their royal robes, at the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria. All the prophets were prophesying before them.
Zedekiah son of Kenaanah made iron horns and said, “This is what the Lord says, ‘With these you will gore Syria until they are destroyed.’”
All the prophets were prophesying the same, saying, “Attack Ramoth Gilead! You will succeed; the Lord will hand it over to the king.”

Now the <st data-num="04397" class="">messenger</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="07121" class="">summon</st> <st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> <st data-num="01696 0559">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, the <st data-num="01697 05030">prophets</st> are in <st data-num="06310 0259">complete agreement</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> will <st data-num="02896" class="">succeed</st>.<n id="1" /> Your <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> <st data-num="04994" class="">must</st> <st data-num="01961 0259">agree</st> with <st data-num="01992" class="">theirs</st>; you must <st data-num="01696" class="">predict</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">success</st>!”<n id="2" />
But Micaiah said, “As certainly as the Lord lives, I will say what my God tells me to say!”
Micaiah came before the king and the king asked him, “Micaiah, should we attack Ramoth Gilead or not?” He answered him, “Attack! You will succeed; they will be handed over to you.”
The king said to him, “How many times must I make you solemnly promise in the name of the Lord to tell me only the truth?”
Micaiah replied, “I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains like sheep that have no shepherd. Then the Lord said, ‘They have no master. They should go home in peace.’”

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">Didn’t</st> I <st data-num="0559 0413">tell</st> you he does <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05012" class="">prophesy</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">prosperity</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> me, <st data-num="03588 0518">but</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st>?”
Micaiah said, “That being the case, listen to the Lord’s message. I saw the Lord sitting on his throne, with all the heavenly assembly standing on his right and on his left.
The Lord said, ‘Who will deceive King Ahab of Israel, so he will attack Ramoth Gilead and die there?’ One said this and another that.
Then a spirit stepped forward and stood before the Lord. He said, ‘I will deceive him.’ The Lord asked him, ‘How?’
He replied, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his prophets.’ The Lord said, ‘Deceive and overpower him. Go out and do as you have proposed.’
So now, look, the Lord has placed a lying spirit in the mouths of all these prophets of yours, but the Lord has decreed disaster for you.”
Zedekiah son of Kenaanah approached, hit Micaiah on the jaw, and said, “Which way did the Lord’s Spirit go when he went from me to speak to you?”

<st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="02005" class="">Look</st>, you will <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> in <st data-num="01931" class="">the</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">when</st> you <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> into an <st data-num="02315" class="">inner</st> <st data-num="02315" class="">room</st> to <st data-num="02244" class="">hide</st>.”

Then the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> <st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> and <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0526" class="">Amon</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">official</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03101" class="">Joash</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.

<st data-num="0559" class="">Say</st>, ‘<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>: “<st data-num="07760" class="">Put</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this man</st> in <st data-num="01004 03608">prison</st>. <st data-num="0398" class="">Give</st> him only a <st data-num="03906" class="">little</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> and <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> I <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">safely</st>.”’”
Micaiah said, “If you really do return safely, then the Lord has not spoken through me!” Then he added, “Take note, all you people.”
The king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah attacked Ramoth Gilead.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st>, “I will <st data-num="02664" class="">disguise</st> myself and then <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>, but <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="03847" class="">wear</st> your <st data-num="0899" class="">royal attire</st>.” So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="02664" class="">disguised</st> himself and they <st data-num="0935" class="">entered</st> the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>.

Now the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> had <st data-num="06680 0559">ordered</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">his</st> <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st>, “Do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03898 0854">fight</st> <st data-num="06996" class="">common soldiers</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">or</st> <st data-num="01419" class="">high ranking officers</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588 0518 0854">fight</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">only</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>!”
When the chariot commanders saw Jehoshaphat, they said, “He must be the king of Israel!” So they turned and attacked him, but Jehoshaphat cried out. The Lord helped him; God lured them away from him.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> <st data-num="07200 03588">realized</st> he <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, they <st data-num="07725" class="">turned away</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">from</st> him.

Now an <st data-num="0376" class="">archer</st> <st data-num="04900" class="">shot</st> an <st data-num="07198" class="">arrow</st> <st data-num="08537" class="">at random</st>,<n id="1" /> and it <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="01694" class="">plates</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">of</st> his <st data-num="08302" class="">armor</st>. The king<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st> his <st data-num="07395" class="">charioteer</st>, “<st data-num="02015" class="">Turn</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">around</st> and <st data-num="03318" class="">take</st> me <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">battle line</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I am <st data-num="02470" class="">wounded</st>.”
While the battle raged throughout the day, the king of Israel stood propped up in his chariot opposite the Syrians. He died in the evening as the sun was setting.
